answerText: Shellshock [or Bashdoor][10] Shellshock was a security bug which targeted this popular Unix/Linux shell and scripting language, which can be compared to others like Zsh and Dash.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2015 | Louisiana Tech + RIT + John Hopkins A | 1 | Science | Computer Science | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Note to moderator: Do not read the alternate answer to the first part of this bonus aloud. 1. This security bug in a common Unix software program was considered by some experts to be more significant than the previous Heartbleed bug. For 10 points each: [10] Give the common name for this critical security bug officially announced in September 2014, which left CGI servers and PHP code using the exec() function vulnerable to attack.
